business.headline: How to execute a will properly, so your family avoids delays and disputesThe truth is, writing a will is only half the job. The real work begins afterwards. One missing document, one unclear clause or one forgotten instruction is enough to turn a simple inheritance into months of delay and dispute.

Expert explains why your 12% equity returns aren't realMost people believe a 12% equity return is strong growth, but according to an expert, the actual gain after inflation and taxes is much smaller. Here's why your money may not be growing as much as you think.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

Using BNPL regularly? Your salary may be hiding an invisible debt trapHaving easy access to credit at the tap of your finger via BNPL feels convenient, but could those small pay-later purchases be quietly building into a debt trap that only shows up on payday?

From SSY to FDs: 3 smart investment schemes every parent should knowPlanning for a child's future requires wise financial choices. From government-backed savings to bank deposits, these three investments offer stability and dependable returns for parents.

Verizon to slash 15% of workforce. What's driving the massive cuts?The telecom giant has been under pressure as rivals AT&T and T-Mobile continue to offer cheaper plans and aggressive promotions, especially during the launch of new iPhone models.

Bars, coins or digital: How Indians are buying gold differently after prices crossed Rs 1 lakhFor the first time, gold breached the psychological barrier of Rs 1 lakh, a milestone that once seemed out of reach. Until that point, conversations around gold were filled with speculation: "Will gold really touch one lakh?" But once that threshold was crossed, the sentiment changed entirely.

Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 1: Check latest GMP and subscription statusCapillary operates in the AI-led SaaS and customer loyalty solutions space, serving more than 410 brands across 47 countries. The company turned profitable in FY25 after two years of losses, reporting Rs 14.15 crore in profit. Revenue increased to Rs 598 crore in FY25.

Pine Labs shares list at 10% premium: Should you hold or book profit now?Pine Labs' better-than-expected debut and strong institutional support boosted early sentiment, but analysts say elevated valuations and intense fintech competition mean investors should balance listing-day gains with disciplined, long-term positioning.

Can a daughter's name be removed from pension records? Government explainsSeveral departments had asked whether a daughter's name should be removed from the family list after an employee retires. To settle the confusion, the DoP&PW issued an Office Memorandum clearly stating that her name must stay in the records.

Adani Group to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh: ReportSpeaking at a state event on Friday, Karan Adani said the investments are aimed at expanding the conglomerate's infrastructure footprint in the southern state and strengthening its long-term presence in high-growth sectors.

Sagility share price jumps over 6% today. What's driving the rally?Sagility's shares jumped after a large block deal hit the tape, with buyers overpowering supply. The stock's sharp rise suggests traders are betting the stake sale won't derail its near-term momentum.
Pine Labs share price: Stock lists at 10% premium over IPO pricePine Labs shares opened at Rs 242 on the BSE and NSE. The listing performance was slightly better than grey market expectations.

entertainment.headline: Mahesh Babu remembers father Krishna ahead of GlobeTrotter event Actor Mahesh Babu expresses heartfelt memories of his father Krishna as he launches SSMB 29 Globetrotter with filmmaker SS Rajamouli and co-stars at a major event in Hyderabad.

Super Junior-D&E Exclusive: K-Pop Duo on Their Chemistry and Two-Decade Friendship K-pop duo Super Junior-D&E, composed of members Donghae and Eunhyuk, spoke to India Today's Bhavna Agarwal about their first visit to India. The sub-unit of the group Super Junior, which was part of the initial Hallyu wave, expressed their excitement, stating, 'We always wanted to meet our Indian fans'.

We mistake burnout for commitment: Deepika pushes for 8-hour shifts in Bollywood Actor Deepika Padukone has brought attention to working conditions in the film industry by advocating for an eight-hour shift and calling for increased support for new mothers, following reports of her exit from major projects.

Dining With The Kapoors trailer: A feast of food, family secrets and Kapoor madness Netflix unveiled the trailer of the upcoming documentary special 'Dining With The Kapoors'. It offers an inside look at the Kapoor family as they gather to celebrate Raj Kapoor's 100th birthday.

#PriyankaChopraIsBack: 'GlobeTrotter' look as Mandakini goes viral in 24 hours Priyanka Chopra's first-look poster as Mandakini from SS Rajamouli's upcoming film starring Mahesh Babu has gone viral, ahead of the film's grand 'GlobeTrotter' event in Hyderabad on November 15

SAG Awards renamed to The Actor Awards by SAG-AFTRA after 30 years The longstanding Screen Actors Guild Awards have now adopted a new title aligning with its signature statuette and union merger, reflecting its evolving identity while maintaining core values and traditions.

De De Pyaar De 2 box office Day 1: Ajay's film starts strong with Rs 9.45 crore Ajay Devgn's latest release 'De De Pyaar De 2' released in theatres on November 14. The film, which received rave reviews, opened on an impressive note at the box office.

Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur to arrive 3 days ahead of schedule, but there's a catch As fans eagerly wait for Farhan Akhtar's '120 Bahadur', IndiaToday.in has exclusively learned that the makers have decided to release the film before its scheduled date. However, there's a twist.

Chupke Chupke: When Dharmendra and Amitabh got into a prank war As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Chupke Chupke. The film, released in 1975, the same year as Sholay, turned Dharmendra's iconic "Garam Dharam" image upside down with a wink and a laugh.

At 60, SRK's Chaiyya Chaiyya moves with Farah wow fans all over again. Watch Bollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan and choreographer Farah Khan entertained attendees at a recent Mumbai event, marking the unveiling of the Shahrukhz tower, with a dance performance to the classic song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya'. The event drew attention both for the property launch and Khan's noteworthy energy at 60.

Wuthering Heights trailer: Margot Robbie, Jacob Elordi blaze in dark love tale The trailer for Emerald Fennell's adaptation of Emily Bronte's novel 'Wuthering Heights', starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi, was released on Thursday. The preview highlights the characters' early connection and the challenges they face as they grow older.

Dining With The Kapoors: Kareena finds Taimur's twin in Saif's childhood pic Netflix has unveiled a teaser for 'Dining With The Kapoors', offering viewers an intimate look at the Kapoor family's traditions and playful moments ahead of the show's trailer release.

Rajkummar Rao, Patralekhaa welcome baby girl on 4th wedding anniversary Congratulations have been pouring in for the couple, Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa, as they welcomed a baby girl on their fourth wedding anniversary. The two, who got married in 2021, announced their pregnancy in July.

What does she want? South rom-coms finally let women have agency South Indian romantic comedies are redefining storytelling by focusing on women's perspectives. This shift challenges traditional tropes and finds strong audience support, signalling a cultural change.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19: And then there were nine, so who'll be crowned winner? 'Bigg Boss 19', hosted by Salman Khan, is set to conclude soon with nine finalists battling for the trophy. Here are all the contestants, with their pros, cons and equation with the host.

BB 19 Day 83: Gaurav overthrown after ration cut; Malti faces sexuality rumours Day 83 of Bigg Boss 19 saw Gaurav Khanna rapidly dethroned after sacrificing the ration for captaincy, landing him in nominations. The episode escalated with a sexuality discussion about Malti Chahar, a major Tanya-Farrhana clash, and Pranit More's stand-up critique.

In Your Dreams review: Netflix serves up a warm, dreamy, feel-good storyRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 In Your Dreams movie review: Netflix's animated film is a heartwarming story of a brother-sister duo out on a dreamy adventure to ensure their 'family stay together, happily'.

SRK launches first-ever property named after him: My mother would have been proud Shah Rukh Khan launched the first-ever property named after him. He was also accompanied by choreographer Farah Khan at the grand event.

Tere Ishk Mein trailer: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon unleash love's madness, heartbreak The trailer of Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's much-awaited film 'Tere Ishk Mein' is finally out. Directed by Aanand L Rai, the film is slated to release on November 28.

general news.headline: BJP cracks down on Bihar rebels, expels ex-Union Minister, two othersThe Bharatiya Janata Party has taken strict disciplinary action by expelling former Union Minister RK Singh for six years due to anti-party activities. This move also includes suspensions of other Bihar leaders amid efforts to curb internal dissent.

Ups and downs inevitable, we're party of poor: RJD's 1st reaction after Bihar routRJD called its Bihar defeat part of a longer political struggle, even as its tally fell to 25 seats. The NDA swept the polls, while the Congress posted one of its weakest showings.

Loud thud, fireball shot: Video shows blast at J&K police station that killed 9A powerful accidental blast inside Nowgam Police Station in Jammu and Kashmir killed nine and injured 32 while teams were handling seized explosives. CCTV footage later revealed the scale of destruction.

IND vs SA 1st Test Day 2 Live: South Africa lose both openersIndia vs South Africa 1st Test Day 2 Live Score and Updates: Indian spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja have removed both South African openers Ryan Rickelton and Aiden Markram in quick succession to give India the momentum in the low-scoring contest.

Chupke Chupke: When Dharmendra and Amitabh got into a prank warAs part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Chupke Chupke. The film, released in 1975, the same year as Sholay, turned Dharmendra's iconic "Garam Dharam" image upside down with a wink and a laugh.

Tejashwi Yadav may have lost Bihar polls, but his party is a crorepatiBihar election results: The RJD, which won 25 of the 143 seats it contested, secured 23% of the vote share - the highest by a single party in the elections. It is more than the BJP and JD(U).

Army deploys monorail at 16,000 feet in Himalayas to boost food, ammo supplyA first-of-its-kind indigenous mono rail system deployed at 16,000 feet is revolutionising high-altitude logistics for the Indian Army's Gajraj Corps, ensuring uninterrupted supply lines in extreme terrain.

Punjab woman goes missing in Pak during jatha, converts to Islam, marries localSarabjeet Kaur, a Sikh pilgrim from Punjab, went missing during a religious visit to Pakistan and is said to have converted to Islam and married there.

We mistake burnout for commitment: Deepika pushes for 8-hour shifts in BollywoodActor Deepika Padukone has brought attention to working conditions in the film industry by advocating for an eight-hour shift and calling for increased support for new mothers, following reports of her exit from major projects.

Why MGB failed in Bihar? Tejashwi couldn't get tiger and deer to drink togetherRJD leader Tejashwi Yadav wanted to paint a picture where the tiger and the deer drink side by side. It was that of the Ram Rajya where Bihar would be at peace with itself. But the overzealous, unwarranted and violent roars of the Yadav cadre revived old fears. The noise turned the imagery of the tranquil pond into a reminder of Jungle Raj. Tejashwi's promises, it seemed, were devoid of the promise of harmony.

Some said I was finished, but I fought to resurrect Chirag Paswan after Bihar winUnion Minister Chirag Paswan said he revived the Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) from being written off in 2020, leading it to win 19 of 29 contested seats in Bihar as the NDA secured a massive assembly victory.

Bihar Singham stumbles: Ex-IPS officer poll debut falls flat after twin-seat defeatFormer IPS officer and Bihar's "Singham" Shivdeep Lande faced a setback in his political debut, losing both Araria and Jamalpur seats in the 2025 Assembly elections.

Wed-cations to convertible couture, what all to expect this shaadi seasonThe wedding season has officially begun, and this year comes with fresh trends, new ideas, and a whole lot of personality. Curious about what's in and what's fading out? We asked the experts to break it down.

Shubman Gill has neck spasm: BCCI after Indian skipper retires hurt in KolkataThe BCCI has issued an update on Shubman Gill after the Indian captain retired hurt on Day 2 of the Kolkata Test on Saturday, 15 November. Gill struck a boundary before leaving the field moments later, returning to the pavilion after appearing to be in discomfort.

Terror module: Dr Shaheen gave Haryana mosque address to obtain SIM cardDr Shaheen, who was staying in the hostel of Al-Falah University campus, obtained the SIM using the address of a mosque in Haryana's Dhouj.

Who is Dr Nisar Hassan, 'ticking time bomb' under lens in Faridabad terror probeOnce dismissed as a "ticking time bomb" by the Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor for alleged separatist leanings, Dr Nisar ul Hassan is back under scrutiny as investigators probe his links to a "white-collar" Jaish module tied to the Red Fort blast case.

SRK launches first-ever property named after him: My mother would have been proudShah Rukh Khan launched the first-ever property named after him. He was also accompanied by choreographer Farah Khan at the grand event.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Surgeon detained in Pathankot, was likely in touch with Delhi blast accusedDelhi blast case: Despite leaving Al-Falah University four years back, the doctor was in regular touch with staff at the Faridabad institution.

Video: Gurugram man critically injured as bungee cord breaks mid-jump in RishikeshA Gurugram man was critically injured after a bungee cord snapped mid-jump in Rishikesh, which triggered outrage and questions about safety measures and regulatory oversight in adventure sports.

What does she want? South rom-coms finally let women have agencySouth Indian romantic comedies are redefining storytelling by focusing on women's perspectives. This shift challenges traditional tropes and finds strong audience support, signalling a cultural change.

Video: CCTV shows shockwaves from Red Fort blast shaking ground 40 feet belowExclusive CCTV from the underground Red Fort Metro station shows how fierce the blast was. The tremors shook the station nearly 40 feet below, jolting food counters and startling commuters. The violent vibration captured on camera underlines the sheer force of the explosion above.

Chirag Paswan meets Nitish Kumar amid Bihar chief minister suspense Live UpdatesBihar Chief Minister: While Chirag Paswan, once Nitish Kumar's bete noire, said he went to congratulate the JD(U) chief, rumour mills are on an overdrive, suggesting he may be eyeing the deputy chief minister post.

Wholesale purge: Congress' Kerala unit claims SIR helped NDA win 128 seats in BiharCongress' Kerala unit alleges Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision drive (SIR) drive arbitrarily deleted genuine voters, influencing 128 NDA wins in Bihar election.

We mistake burnout for commitment: Deepika pushes for 8-hour shifts in BollywoodActor Deepika Padukone has brought attention to working conditions in the film industry by advocating for an eight-hour shift and calling for increased support for new mothers, following reports of her exit from major projects.

sports.headline: IPL retention live updates: After Ravindra Jadeja, CSK set to release Pathirana IPL 2026 retention live updates: After a few busy trades, all 10 teams are ready to announce their list of retained and released players. The official broadcasters are set to announce retentions at 5 pm IST. Follow us for all the buzz and updates.

Samson-Jadeja swap between CSK and RR benefits all parties involved: Anil Kumble Anil Kumble feels that the Sanju Samson and Ravindra Jadeja swap deal between CSK and RR will benefit all parties involved. Samson was exchanged for Jadeja and Sam Curran by RR on IPL retentions deadline day.

Ravindra Jadeja achieves rare Test double; joins Kapil, Botham in elite list Ravindra Jadeja joined Kapil Dev in an elite list on Saturday, becoming only the fourth cricketer in history to complete the illustrious double of 4,000 runs and 300 wickets in Test cricket.

Shubman Gill has neck spasm: BCCI after Indian skipper retires hurt in Kolkata The BCCI has issued an update on Shubman Gill after the Indian captain retired hurt on Day 2 of the Kolkata Test on Saturday, 15 November. Gill struck a boundary before leaving the field moments later, returning to the pavilion after appearing to be in discomfort.

Ravindra Jadeja on rejoining RR from CSK: Coming back feels special Star all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja said coming back to Rajasthan Royals feels special after joining the franchise from Chennai Super Kings ahead of the 2026 edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL).

Croatia secure World Cup 2026 spot, Germany and Netherlands edge closer Croatia secured automatic qualification for the World Cup after a 3–1 comeback win against the Faroe Islands, while Germany and the Netherlands moved closer to booking their places following tense qualifiers.

Rishabh Pant breaks Virender Sehwag's record with most Test sixes for India Rishabh Pant broke Virender Sehwag's record for the most Test sixes by an Indian, moving to 92 with a blistering knock on Day 2 at Eden Gardens. His fearless 27 off 24 balls lifted him to seventh on the all-time global six-hitters list.

Fans will be upset over Ravindra Jadeja exit, but CSK felt need for change: CEO CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan explained why they decided to trade Ravindra Jadeja and Sam Curran to get the services of Sanju Samson from RR. Jadeja left Chennai after being one of their most decorated players and spending 12 seasons.

Big blow for India as Shubman Gill retires hurt with injury scare in Kolkata India were handed an early concern on Day 2 of the Kolkata Test after captain Shubman Gill walked off the field with a neck strain, cutting short his innings only moments after arriving at the crease.

IPL 2026: Arjun Tendulkar and Shami move to LSG, Nitish Rana heads to DC LSG have completed a double move to secure the services of Arjun Tendulkar and Mohammed Shami from MI and SRH respectively. DC got the services of Nitish Rana from RR as they sent Donovan Ferreira in the other direction.

Sanju Samson joins CSK, Ravindra Jadeja back in Rajasthan after a decade CSK's decision to overhaul its core has triggered one of the most significant trades in recent IPL history, with Sanju Samson moving to Chennai for Rs 18 crore and Ravindra Jadeja returning to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 14 crore.

Rishabh Pant breaks Virender Sehwag's record with most Test sixes for India Rishabh Pant broke Virender Sehwag's record for the most Test sixes by an Indian, moving to 92 with a blistering knock on Day 2 at Eden Gardens. His fearless 27 off 24 balls lifted him to seventh on the all-time global six-hitters list.

Fans will be upset over Ravindra Jadeja exit, but CSK felt need for change: CEO CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan explained why they decided to trade Ravindra Jadeja and Sam Curran to get the services of Sanju Samson from RR. Jadeja left Chennai after being one of their most decorated players and spending 12 seasons.

Sanju Samson joins CSK, Ravindra Jadeja back in Rajasthan after a decade CSK's decision to overhaul its core has triggered one of the most significant trades in recent IPL history, with Sanju Samson moving to Chennai for Rs 18 crore and Ravindra Jadeja returning to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 14 crore.

Australia suffer injury blow as Josh Hazlewood ruled out of first Ashes TestAustralia have suffered a major setback ahead of the opening Ashes Test in Perth, with senior seamer Josh Hazlewood ruled out due to a hamstring strain, and Michael Neser, who has played two Tests, drafted in as cover.

What to expect on IPL 2026 retention deadline dayIPL 2026 retention deadline day buzz: With Chennai Super Kings and Rajasthan Royals set to swap Ravindra Jadeja and Sanju Samson, and Mohammed Shami joining Lucknow Super Giants alongside Arjun Tendulkar, the build-up has already delivered blockbuster trades ahead of the 5 PM IST deadline on November 15.

Ashes: Zak Crawley confident England will be ready despite limited preparationsOpener Zak Crawley is confident England will be ready for next week's first Ashes Test against Australia in Perth, despite criticism over the team's limited preparation ahead of the five-match series.

Babar Azam on ending hundred drought: When Allah has written something, it happensBabar Azam was ecstatic after ending his century drought during the second ODI win against Sri Lanka. Babar ended an 807-day drought to help Pakistan clinch the series and he praised the almighty for the feat.

Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja swap deal between CSK and RR completed: ReportThe Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja deal between CSK and RR has been completed, according to a latest report. The Royals will also get Sam Curran along with Jadeja as Samson heads in the other direction.

World champion Deepti Sharma felicitated at UP Police Headquarters in LucknowDeepti Sharma, the Player of the Tournament at the Women's ODI World Cup and newly appointed DSP in the Uttar Pradesh Police under the sports quota, was felicitated on Friday at the State Police Headquarters in Gomtinagar Extension.

IND vs SA 1st Test Day 2 Live: South Africa lose both openersIndia vs South Africa 1st Test Day 2 Live Score and Updates: Indian spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja have removed both South African openers Ryan Rickelton and Aiden Markram in quick succession to give India the momentum in the low-scoring contest.

Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja swap deal between CSK and RR completed: ReportThe Sanju Samson-Ravindra Jadeja deal between CSK and RR has been completed, according to a latest report. The Royals will also get Sam Curran along with Jadeja as Samson heads in the other direction.

World champion Deepti Sharma felicitated at UP Police Headquarters in LucknowDeepti Sharma, the Player of the Tournament at the Women's ODI World Cup and newly appointed DSP in the Uttar Pradesh Police under the sports quota, was felicitated on Friday at the State Police Headquarters in Gomtinagar Extension.

IND vs SA 1st Test Day 2 Live: South Africa lose both openersIndia vs South Africa 1st Test Day 2 Live Score and Updates: Indian spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja have removed both South African openers Ryan Rickelton and Aiden Markram in quick succession to give India the momentum in the low-scoring contest.

IPL 2026 retentions complete guide: Rules, live streaming details, team purseThe deadline for all ten franchises of the Indian Premier League to reveal their list of retained and released players is 15th November 2024. As the teams finalise their squad for the mini auction scheduled in December, here's our complete guide to IPL 2026 retention rules.

Devon Conway confirms CSK exit ahead of IPL 2026 retentions, thanks fansNew Zealand opener Devon Conway has confirmed his release from the Chennai Super Kings on Friday, November 14, a day ahead of the IPL 2026 retentions. Conway spent three years with CSK and thanked the fans.

Babar Azam ends 807-day century drought, equals Saeed Anwar's ODI recordBabar Azam ended his 807-day century drought with an unbeaten 102 against Sri Lanka in the 2nd ODI in Rawalpindi. His innings helped Pakistan chase down 289 and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Wrestling body lifts suspension of Olympic medallist Aman for missing weightThe Wrestling Federation of India has lifted the suspensions of Aman Sehrawat and Neha Sangwan for weight violations. This decision allows them to enter the Pro Wrestling League auction, but warns of stricter action for any future lapses.

IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada's availability remains uncertain for 2nd TestKagiso Rabada remains a doubtful starter for the second Test against India after missing the series opener due to a rib injury. South Africa are awaiting further medical assessments to determine his availability.

Tough self-judge? Vaibhav Suryavanshi rates his 42-ball 144 out of 100Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi lit up Doha with a stunning 42-ball 144, but the 14-year-old wasn't fully satisfied. Even after one of the biggest knocks of his young career, he rated it with striking honesty and restraint.

No magic, just mastery: Jasprit Bumrah on dismantling South Africa in Kolkata TestIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah turned a dry Eden Gardens pitch into his stage, ripping through South Africa with a superb five-for. After silencing fitness critics, he reminded everyone that his craft isn't magic but pure skill, patience and relentless accuracy.

South Africa coach plays down Jasprit Bumrah's 'bauna' remark for Temba BavumaSouth Africa batting coach Ashwell Prince has dismissed concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's on-field remark about Temba Bavuma during the opening day of the first Test at Eden Gardens. Prince clarified that the team will not discuss the incident, while no complaint will be made regarding the exchange captured on the stump mic.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
